subsections.name: Understanding the organization and its context
subsections.description: The organization shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and that affect its ability to achieve the intended result(s) of its AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

programControlMapping.name: Information Security Management System
programControlMapping.description: The company designs, implements, and maintains an ISMS consisting of a coherent set of policies, procedures, and processes to manage risk to its information assets.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

subsections.name: Understanding the organization and its context
subsections.description: The organization shall determine whether climate change is a relevant issue.

programControlMapping.name: AI system environmental impact
programControlMapping.description: As part of its risk assessment process, the company considers environmental and sustainability risks associated with AI.

subsections.name: Understanding the organization and its context
subsections.description: The organization shall consider the intended purpose of the AI systems that are developed, provided or used by the organization. The organization shall determine its roles with respect to these AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI Purpose and Scope Assessment
programControlMapping.description: The AI's purpose and scope is assessed to ensure alignment with intended objectives and operational boundaries.

subsections.name: Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties
subsections.description: The organization shall determine: — the interested parties that are relevant to the AI management system; — the relevant requirements of these interested parties; — which of these requirements will be addressed through the AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: Interested Parties - AI
programControlMapping.description: The identification and analysis of interested parties relevant to AI are regularly updated and documented.

subsections.name: Determining the scope of the AI management system
subsections.description: The organization shall determine the boundaries and applicability of the AI management system to establish its scope.

programControlMapping.name: AI Purpose and Scope Assessment
programControlMapping.description: The AI's purpose and scope is assessed to ensure alignment with intended objectives and operational boundaries.

subsections.name: Determining the scope of the AI management system
subsections.description: When determining this scope, the organization shall consider: — the external and internal issues referred to in 4.1; — the requirements referred to in 4.2.

programControlMapping.name: AI Purpose and Scope Assessment
programControlMapping.description: The AI's purpose and scope is assessed to ensure alignment with intended objectives and operational boundaries.

subsections.name: Determining the scope of the AI management system
subsections.description: The scope shall be available as documented information.

programControlMapping.name: AI Purpose and Scope Assessment
programControlMapping.description: The AI's purpose and scope is assessed to ensure alignment with intended objectives and operational boundaries.

subsections.name: Determining the scope of the AI management system
subsections.description: The scope of the AI management system shall determine the organization’s activities with respect to this document’s requirements on the AI management system, leadership, planning, support, operation, performance, evaluation, improvement, controls and objectives.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

subsections.name: AI management system
subsections.description: The organization shall establish, implement, maintain, continually improve and document an AI management system, including the processes needed and their interactions, in accordance with the requirements of this document.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Management System Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Management System (ISMS) at the company. The ISMS requires the design, implementation, and maintenance of a coherent set of policies, processes, and systems to manage risks to the company's information assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.name: Leadership and commitment
subsections.description: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the AI management system by: — ensuring that the AI policy (see 5.2) and AI objectives (see 6.2) are established and are compatible with the strategic direction of the organization; — ensuring the integration of the AI management system requirements into the organization’s business processes; — ensuring that the resources needed for the AI management system are available; — communicating the importance of effective AI management and of conforming to the AI management system requirements; — ensuring that the AI management system achieves its intended result(s); — directing and supporting persons to contribute to the effectiveness of the AI management system; — promoting continual improvement; — supporting other relevant roles to demonstrate their leadership as it applies to their areas of responsibility.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programControlMapping.name: External Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company commissions external third-party assessments to validate its compliance controls. Assessment results are documented and reviewed by company leadership

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

programControlMapping.name: Management Review Program
programControlMapping.description: The management review team meets on periodic basis to discuss the continual improvement of the ISMS.

subsections.name: AI policy
subsections.description: Top management shall establish an AI policy that: a) is appropriate to the purpose of the organization; b) provides a framework for setting AI objectives (see 6.2); c) includes a commitment to meet applicable requirements; d) includes a commitment to continual improvement of the AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

subsections.name: AI policy
subsections.description: The AI policy shall: — be available as documented information; — refer as relevant to other organizational policies; — be communicated within the organization; — be available to interested parties, as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

subsections.name: Roles, responsibilities and authorities
subsections.description: Top management shall ensure that the responsibilities and authorities for relevant roles are assigned and communicated within the organization.

programControlMapping.name: Board of Directors
programControlMapping.description: A Board of Directors exercises independent oversight of the company's strategic direction, operational performance, and internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Job Descriptions
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities of company employees are communicated through documented job descriptions.

programControlMapping.name: Organizational Structure
programControlMapping.description: The company has an appropriate organizational structure based on functional departments, with an executive leader heading each department.

subsections.name: Roles, responsibilities and authorities
subsections.description: Top management shall assign the responsibility and authority for: a) ensuring that the AI management system conforms to the requirements of this document; b) reporting on the performance of the AI management system to top management.

programControlMapping.name: Management Review Program
programControlMapping.description: The management review team meets on periodic basis to discuss the continual improvement of the ISMS.

programControlMapping.name: AI risk management roles
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities related to the management of AI Risks are documented, and risk management decision making is informed by a team diverse in demographics, disciplines, experience, expertise, and backgrounds.

programPolicyMapping.title: Human Resources Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements for a comprehensive human resources process wherein the company attracts, develops, and retains competent and high-performing individuals capable of achieving the company's business and security objectives.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Internal Audit Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define the objectives, authority, and responsibilities of the Internal Audit role within the company.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Management System Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Management System (ISMS) at the company. The ISMS requires the design, implementation, and maintenance of a coherent set of policies, processes, and systems to manage risks to the company's information assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: When planning for the AI management system, the organization shall consider the issues referred to in 4.1 and the requirements referred to in 4.2 and determine the risks and opportunities that need to be addressed to: — give assurance that the AI management system can achieve its intended result(s); — prevent or reduce undesired effects; — achieve continual improvement.

programControlMapping.name: Statement of Applicability
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Statement of Applicability document, which summarizes the organization's position on each ISO 27001 Annex A control.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The organization shall establish and maintain AI risk criteria that support: — distinguishing acceptable from non-acceptable risks; — performing AI risk assessments; — conducting AI risk treatment; — assessing AI risk impacts.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The organization shall determine the risks and opportunities according to: — the domain and application context of an AI system; — the intended use; — the external and internal context described in 4.1.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The organization shall plan: a) actions to address these risks and opportunities; b) how to: 1) integrate and implement the actions into its AI management system processes; 2) evaluate the effectiveness of these actions.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The organization shall retain documented information on actions taken to identify and address AI risks and AI opportunities.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The organization shall define and establish an AI risk assessment process that: a) is informed by and aligned with the AI policy (see 5.2) and AI objectives (see 6.2); b) is designed such that repeated AI risk assessments can produce consistent, valid and comparable results; c) identifies risks that aid or prevent achieving its AI objectives; d) analyses the AI risks to: 1) assess the potential consequences to the organization, individuals and societies that would result if the identified risks were to materialize; 2) assess, where applicable, the realistic likelihood of the identified risks; 3) determine the levels of risk; e) evaluates the AI risks to: 1) compare the results of the risk analysis with the risk criteria (see 6.1.1); 2) prioritize the assessed risks for risk treatment. The organization shall retain documented information about the AI risk assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

programControlMapping.name: AI Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: Taking the risk assessment results into account, the organization shall define an AI risk treatment process to: a) select appropriate AI risk treatment options; b) determine all controls that are necessary to implement the AI risk treatment options chosen and compare the controls with those in Annex A to verify that no necessary controls have been omitted; NOTE 1 Annex A provides reference controls for meeting organizational objectives and addressing risks related to the design and use of AI systems. c) consider the controls from Annex A that are relevant for the implementation of the AI risk treatment options; d) identify if additional controls are necessary beyond those in Annex A in order to implement all risk treatment options; e) consider the guidance in Annex B for the implementation of controls determined in b) and c); NOTE 2 Control objectives are implicitly included in the controls chosen. The organization can select an appropriate set of control objectives and controls from Annex A. The Annex A controls are not exhaustive and additional control objectives and controls can be needed. If different or additional controls are necessary beyond those in Annex A, the organization can design such controls or take them from existing sources. AI risk management can be integrated in other management systems, if applicable. f) produce a statement of applicability that contains the necessary controls [see b), c) and d)] and provide justification for inclusion and exclusion of controls. Justification for exclusion can include where the controls are not deemed necessary by the risk assessment and where they are not required by (or are subject to exceptions under) applicable external requirements. NOTE 3 The organization can provide documented justifications for excluding any control objectives in general or for specific AI systems, whether those listed in Annex A or established by the organization itself. g) formulate an AI risk treatment plan.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: AI Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The organization shall obtain approval from the designated management for the AI risk treatment plan and for acceptance of the residual AI risks. The necessary controls shall be: — aligned to the objectives in 6.2; — available as documented information; — communicated within the organization; — available to interested parties, as appropriate.

programControlMapping.description: Documentation of AI system impact assessments is maintained and updated regularly.

subsections.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.description: The AI system impact assessment shall determine the potential consequences an AI system’s deployment, intended use and foreseeable misuse has on individuals or groups of individuals, or both, and societies.

programControlMapping.description: Documentation of AI system impact assessments is maintained and updated regularly.

programControlMapping.description: Documentation of AI system impact assessments is maintained and updated regularly.

subsections.description: The organization shall consider the results of the AI system impact assessment in the risk assessment (see 6.1.2). A.5 in Table A.1 provides controls for assessing impacts of AI systems.

subsections.name: AI objectives and planning to achieve them
subsections.description: The AI objectives shall: a) be consistent with the AI policy (see 5.2); b) be measurable (if practicable); c) take into account applicable requirements; d) be monitored; e) be communicated; f) be updated as appropriate; g) be available as documented information.

programControlMapping.name: AI Responsible Use Policy
programControlMapping.description: The AI Responsible Use Policy outlines the processes for the responsible use of AI systems.

subsections.name: AI objectives and planning to achieve them
subsections.description: When planning how to achieve its AI objectives, the organization shall determine: — what will be done; — what resources will be required; — who will be responsible; — when it will be completed; — how the results will be evaluated.

programControlMapping.name: AI Responsible Use Policy
programControlMapping.description: The AI Responsible Use Policy outlines the processes for the responsible use of AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy

subsections.name: Competence
subsections.description: The organization shall: — determine the necessary competence of person(s) doing work under its control that affects its AI performance; — ensure that these persons are competent on the basis of appropriate education, training or experience; — where applicable, take actions to acquire the necessary competence, and evaluate the effectiveness of the actions taken.

programControlMapping.name: Hiring process
programControlMapping.description: The company utilizes a multistep interview process via Greenhouse to evaluate the skills, experience, and qualification of candidates before they are hired by the company.

subsections.name: Competence
subsections.description: Appropriate documented information shall be available as evidence of competence.

programControlMapping.name: Hiring process
programControlMapping.description: The company utilizes a multistep interview process via Greenhouse to evaluate the skills, experience, and qualification of candidates before they are hired by the company.

subsections.name: Awareness
subsections.description: Persons doing work under the organization’s control shall be aware of: — the AI policy (see 5.2); — their contribution to the effectiveness of the AI management system, including the benefits of improved AI performance; — the implications of not conforming with the AI management system requirements.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

subsections.name: Communication
subsections.description: The organization shall determine the internal and external communications relevant to the AI management system including: — what it will communicate; — when to communicate; — with whom to communicate; — how to communicate.

programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

subsections.name: Documented Information
subsections.description: The organization’s AI management system shall include: a) documented information required by this document; b) documented information determined by the organization as being necessary for the effectiveness of the AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

subsections.name: Documented Information
subsections.description: When creating and updating documented information, the organization shall ensure appropriate: — identification and description (e.g. a title, date, author or reference number); — format (e.g. language, software version, graphics) and media (e.g. paper, electronic); — review and approval for suitability and adequacy.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

subsections.name: Documented Information
subsections.description: Documented information required by the AI management system and by this document shall be controlled to ensure: a) it is available and suitable for use, where and when it is needed; b) it is adequately protected (e.g. from loss of confidentiality, improper use or loss of integrity). For the control of documented information, the organization shall address the following activities, as applicable: — distribution, access, retrieval and use; — storage and preservation, including preservation of legibility; — control of changes (e.g. version control); — retention and disposition.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

subsections.name: Documented Information
subsections.description: Documented information of external origin determined by the organization to be necessary for the planning and operation of the AI management system shall be identified as appropriate and controlled.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Retention and Disposal Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish requirements surrounding the retention and eventual disposal of data, in order to ensure confidentiality of sensitive company and customer information.

programPolicyMapping.title: Human Resources Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements for a comprehensive human resources process wherein the company attracts, develops, and retains competent and high-performing individuals capable of achieving the company's business and security objectives.

programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

subsections.description: The organization shall plan, implement and control the processes needed to meet requirements, and to implement the actions determined in Clause 6, by: — establishing criteria for the processes; — implementing control of the processes in accordance with the criteria.

subsections.description: The organization shall implement the controls determined according to 6.1.3 that are related to the operation of the AI management system (e.g. AI system development and usage life cycle related controls).

programControlMapping.name: Control reviews
programControlMapping.description: Management periodically reviews control activities to reaffirm each control's relevance, and updates the set of controls as necessary.

programControlMapping.name: Statement of Applicability
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Statement of Applicability document, which summarizes the organization's position on each ISO 27001 Annex A control.

programControlMapping.name: Statement of Applicability
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Statement of Applicability document, which summarizes the organization's position on each ISO 27001 Annex A control.

programControlMapping.description: Changes are tracked and documented in the source code management system and their business purpose is defined in the project management tool.

subsections.name: Operational planning and control
subsections.description: The organization shall ensure that externally provided processes, products or services that are relevant to the AI management system are controlled.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Vendors are evaluated on a periodic basis, by reviewing their audit reports or other means, in order to track and determine the impact of any changes in their security posture.

subsections.name: AI risk assessment
subsections.description: The organization shall perform AI risk assessments in accordance with 6.1.2 at planned intervals or when significant changes are proposed or occur.

programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

subsections.description: The organization shall retain documented information of the results of all AI risk assessments.

programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.name: AI risk treatment
subsections.description: The organization shall implement the AI risk treatment plan according to 6.1.3 and verify its effectiveness.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.name: AI risk treatment
subsections.description: When risk assessments identify new risks that require treatment, a risk treatment process in accordance with 6.1.3 shall be performed for these risks.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.name: AI risk treatment
subsections.description: When risk treatment options as defined by the risk treatment plan are not effective, these treatment options shall be reviewed and revalidated following the risk treatment process according to 6.1.3 and the risk treatment plan shall be updated.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.name: AI risk treatment
subsections.description: The organization shall retain documented information of the results of all AI risk treatments.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.name: AI system impact assessment
subsections.description: The organization shall perform AI system impact assessments according to 6.1.4 at planned intervals or when significant changes are proposed to occur.

programControlMapping.name: AI system impact assessment procedures
programControlMapping.description: The organization has established and implemented AI system impact assessment procedures.

subsections.name: AI system impact assessment
subsections.description: The organization shall retain documented information of the results of all AI system impact assessments.

programControlMapping.name: Documentation of AI system impact assessments
programControlMapping.description: Documentation of AI system impact assessments is maintained and updated regularly.

programPolicyMapping.title: Change Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Provide guidance on the process of managing change across company critical systems and products.

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Management System Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Management System (ISMS) at the company. The ISMS requires the design, implementation, and maintenance of a coherent set of policies, processes, and systems to manage risks to the company's information assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
subsections.description: The organization shall determine: — what needs to be monitored and measured; — the methods for monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation, as applicable, to ensure valid results; — when the monitoring and measuring shall be performed; — when the results from monitoring and measurement shall be analysed and evaluated.

programControlMapping.name: Control reviews
programControlMapping.description: Management periodically reviews control activities to reaffirm each control's relevance, and updates the set of controls as necessary.

subsections.name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
subsections.description: Documented information shall be available as evidence of the results.

programControlMapping.name: Control reviews
programControlMapping.description: Management periodically reviews control activities to reaffirm each control's relevance, and updates the set of controls as necessary.

subsections.name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
subsections.description: The organization shall evaluate the performance and the effectiveness of the AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: Control reviews
programControlMapping.description: Management periodically reviews control activities to reaffirm each control's relevance, and updates the set of controls as necessary.

subsections.name: Internal audit
subsections.description: The organization shall conduct internal audits at planned intervals to provide information on whether the AI management system: a) conforms to: 1) the organization’s own requirements for its AI management system; 2) the requirements of this document; b) is effectively implemented and maintained.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

subsections.name: Internal audit
subsections.description: The organization shall plan, establish, implement and maintain (an) audit programme(s), including the frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements and reporting.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

subsections.name: Internal audit
subsections.description: When establishing the internal audit programme(s), the organization shall consider the importance of the processes concerned and the results of previous audits.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

subsections.name: Internal audit
subsections.description: The organization shall: a) define the audit objectives, criteria and scope for each audit; b) select auditors and conduct audits to ensure objectivity and the impartiality of the audit process; c) ensure that the results of audits are reported to relevant managers.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

programControlMapping.name: External Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company commissions external third-party assessments to validate its compliance controls. Assessment results are documented and reviewed by company leadership

subsections.name: Internal audit
subsections.description: Documented information shall be available as evidence of the implementation of the audit programme(s) and the audit results.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

programControlMapping.name: External Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company commissions external third-party assessments to validate its compliance controls. Assessment results are documented and reviewed by company leadership

subsections.name: Management review
subsections.description: Top management shall review the organization’s AI management system, at planned intervals, to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

programControlMapping.name: Management Review Program
programControlMapping.description: The management review team meets on periodic basis to discuss the continual improvement of the ISMS.

subsections.name: Management review
subsections.description: The management review shall include: a) the status of actions from previous management reviews; b) changes in external and internal issues that are relevant to the AI management system; c) changes in needs and expectations of interested parties that are relevant to the AI management system; d) information on the AI management system performance, including trends in: 1) nonconformities and corrective actions; 2) monitoring and measurement results; 3) audit results; e) opportunities for continual improvement.

programControlMapping.name: Management Review Program
programControlMapping.description: The management review team meets on periodic basis to discuss the continual improvement of the ISMS.

subsections.name: Management review
subsections.description: The results of the management review shall include decisions related to continual improvement opportunities and any need for changes to the AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: Management Review Program
programControlMapping.description: The management review team meets on periodic basis to discuss the continual improvement of the ISMS.

subsections.name: Management review
subsections.description: Documented information shall be available as evidence of the results of management reviews.

programControlMapping.name: Management Review Program
programControlMapping.description: The management review team meets on periodic basis to discuss the continual improvement of the ISMS.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Audit Logging Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline how systems generate log events for audit purposes, and how these logs are stored and processed to help detect security issues.

programPolicyMapping.title: Internal Audit Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define the objectives, authority, and responsibilities of the Internal Audit role within the company.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Management System Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Management System (ISMS) at the company. The ISMS requires the design, implementation, and maintenance of a coherent set of policies, processes, and systems to manage risks to the company's information assets.

subsections.name: Continual improvement
subsections.description: The organization shall continually improve the suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of the AI management system.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

programControlMapping.name: External Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company commissions external third-party assessments to validate its compliance controls. Assessment results are documented and reviewed by company leadership

subsections.name: Continual improvement
subsections.description: When a nonconformity occurs, the organization shall: a) react to the nonconformity and as applicable: 1) take action to control and correct it; 2) deal with the consequences; b) evaluate the need for action to eliminate the cause(s) of the nonconformity, so that it does not recur or occur elsewhere, by: 1) reviewing the nonconformity; 2) determining the causes of the nonconformity; 3) determining if similar nonconformities exist or can potentially occur; c) implement any action needed; d) review the effectiveness of any corrective action taken; e) make changes to the AI management system, if necessary.

programControlMapping.name: Internal audit
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal audits on an annual basis or after significant changes in the organization's security landscape.

subsections.name: Continual improvement
subsections.description: Corrective actions shall be appropriate to the effects of the nonconformities encountered.

programControlMapping.name: External Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company commissions external third-party assessments to validate its compliance controls. Assessment results are documented and reviewed by company leadership

subsections.name: Continual improvement
subsections.description: Documented information shall be available as evidence of: — the nature of the nonconformities and any subsequent actions taken; — the results of any corrective action.

programControlMapping.name: Corrective actions
programControlMapping.description: Control owners take corrective actions when issues and nonconformities with their controls are identified.

programPolicyMapping.title: Internal Audit Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define the objectives, authority, and responsibilities of the Internal Audit role within the company.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Management System Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Management System (ISMS) at the company. The ISMS requires the design, implementation, and maintenance of a coherent set of policies, processes, and systems to manage risks to the company's information assets.

subsections.name: Allocating responsibilities
subsections.description: The organization shall ensure that responsibilities within their AI system life cycle are allocated between the organization, its partners, suppliers, customers and third parties.

programControlMapping.name: AI risk management roles
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities related to the management of AI Risks are documented, and risk management decision making is informed by a team diverse in demographics, disciplines, experience, expertise, and backgrounds.

subsections.name: Suppliers
subsections.description: The organization shall establish a process to ensure that its usage of services, products or materials provided by suppliers aligns with the organization’s approach to the responsible development and use of AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI vendor review
programControlMapping.description: Regular reviews are conducted to ensure that third-party services utilized by the AI system are aligned with the company AI Governance Policy.

subsections.name: Customers
subsections.description: The organization shall ensure that its responsible approach to the development and use of AI systems considers their customer expectations and needs.

programControlMapping.name: Customer needs
programControlMapping.description: The AI Governance Policy takes into account customer's expectations and needs in regards to the responsible use of AI systems.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: A framework for managing AI risk at the company.

subsections.name: AI policy
subsections.description: The organization shall document a policy for the development or use of AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a documented AI Governance Policy governing the use of AI within the organization.

subsections.name: Alignment with other organizational policies
subsections.description: The organization shall determine where other policies can be affected by or apply to, the organization’s objectives with respect to AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI Inclusion in Organizational Policies
programControlMapping.description: Company policies are routinely reviewed to ensure that the characteristics of trustworthy AI are integrated into those policies.

subsections.name: Review of the AI policy
subsections.description: The AI policy shall be reviewed at planned intervals or additionally as needed to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

programControlMapping.name: AI Governance Policy validation
programControlMapping.description: Regular reviews are conducted to ensure that deployed AI systems are used according to the AI Governance Policy.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

subsections.name: AI roles and responsibilities
subsections.description: Roles and responsibilities for AI shall be defined and allocated according to the needs of the organization.

programControlMapping.name: AI risk management roles
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities related to the management of AI Risks are documented, and risk management decision making is informed by a team diverse in demographics, disciplines, experience, expertise, and backgrounds.

subsections.name: Reporting of concerns
subsections.description: The organization shall define and put in place a process to report concerns about the organization’s role with respect to an AI system throughout its life cycle.

programControlMapping.name: Internal Support Channel
programControlMapping.description: Employees have access to an internal support channel that can be used to report incidents, concerns, and complaints.

programControlMapping.name: AI Concern Reporting Process
programControlMapping.description: The organization defines a process to report concerns about the organization’s role with respect to an AI system throughout its life cycle.

subsections.name: Resource documentation
subsections.description: The organization shall identify and document relevant resources required for the activities at given AI system life cycle stages and other AI-related activities relevant for the organization.

programControlMapping.name: AI Resources documentation
programControlMapping.description: Documentation is maintained for resources required for the lifecycle of AI systems, which includes information on required data, tooling, system, computing, and human resources.

subsections.name: Data resources
subsections.description: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the data resources utilized for the AI system.

programControlMapping.name: AI Resources documentation

subsections.description: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the tooling resources utilized for the AI system.

subsections.name: System and computing resources
subsections.description: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the system and computing resources utilized for the AI system.

programControlMapping.name: AI Resources documentation
programControlMapping.description: Documentation is maintained for resources required for the lifecycle of AI systems, which includes information on required data, tooling, system, computing, and human resources.

subsections.name: Human resources
subsections.description: As part of resource identification, the organization shall document information about the human resources and their competences utilized for the development, deployment, operation, change management, maintenance, transfer and decommissioning, as well as verification and integration of the AI system.

programControlMapping.name: AI Resources documentation
programControlMapping.description: Documentation is maintained for resources required for the lifecycle of AI systems, which includes information on required data, tooling, system, computing, and human resources.

subsections.name: AI system impact assessment process
subsections.description: The organization shall establish a process to assess the potential consequences for individuals or groups of individuals, or both, and societies that can result from the AI system throughout its life cycle.

programControlMapping.name: AI system impact scope
programControlMapping.description: The impacts of implemented AI systems, both beneficial and harmful, are regularly assessed according to the company's standard risk management practices.

programControlMapping.name: AI Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

subsections.name: Documentation of AI system impact assessments
subsections.description: The organization shall document the results of AI system impact assessments and retain results for a defined period.

programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

programControlMapping.name: AI system impact scope
programControlMapping.description: The impacts of implemented AI systems, both beneficial and harmful, are regularly assessed according to the company's standard risk management practices.

subsections.name: Assessing AI system impact on individuals or groups of individuals
subsections.description: The organization shall assess and document the potential impacts of AI systems to individuals or groups of individuals throughout the system’s life cycle.

programControlMapping.name: AI system impact scope
programControlMapping.description: The impacts of implemented AI systems, both beneficial and harmful, are regularly assessed according to the company's standard risk management practices.

programControlMapping.name: AI Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: As part of its Risk Assessment process, the company considers risks associated with its use of AI, and the impact of the company's AI to users, groups, systems, and society.

subsections.name: Assessing societal impacts of AI systems
subsections.description: The organization shall assess and document the potential societal impacts of their AI systems throughout their life cycle.

subsections.name: Objectives for responsible development of AI system
subsections.description: The organization shall identify and document objectives to guide the responsible development AI systems, and take those objectives into account and integrate measures to achieve them in the development life cycle.

programControlMapping.name: Responsible Development of AI Systems
programControlMapping.description: The company has identified objectives and processes to ensure the responsible development of AI systems, and integrated those processes into the SDLC life cycle.

subsections.name: Processes for responsible AI system design and development
subsections.description: The organization shall define and document the specific processes for the responsible design and development of the AI system.

programControlMapping.name: AI SDLC culture
programControlMapping.description: The company fosters a critical thinking and safety-first mindset in its AI SDLC procedures, in order to mitigate against potential negative impacts.

subsections.name: AI system requirements and specification
subsections.description: The organization shall specify and document requirements for new AI systems or material enhancements to existing systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI system lifecycle
programControlMapping.description: The company has integrated its AI system lifecycle into its standard Agile, Quality, and CICD processes, with special consideration for the unique properties of AI systems balanced against organizational risks.

subsections.name: Documentation of AI system design and development
subsections.description: The organization shall document the AI system design and development based on organizational objectives, documented requirements and specification criteria.

programControlMapping.name: AI system lifecycle
programControlMapping.description: The company has integrated its AI system lifecycle into its standard Agile, Quality, and CICD processes, with special consideration for the unique properties of AI systems balanced against organizational risks.

subsections.name: AI system verification and validation
subsections.description: The organization shall define and document verification and validation measures for the AI system and specify criteria for their use.

programControlMapping.name: AI Quality Process
programControlMapping.description: A quality process is defined to ensure that AI systems are valid and reliable.  Any limitations to the generalizability beyond the conditions under which the technology was developed are documented.

programControlMapping.name: AI system lifecycle
programControlMapping.description: The company has integrated its AI system lifecycle into its standard Agile, Quality, and CICD processes, with special consideration for the unique properties of AI systems balanced against organizational risks.

subsections.name: AI system deployment
subsections.description: The organization shall document a deployment plan and ensure that appropriate requirements are met prior to deployment.

programControlMapping.name: AI system lifecycle
programControlMapping.description: The company has integrated its AI system lifecycle into its standard Agile, Quality, and CICD processes, with special consideration for the unique properties of AI systems balanced against organizational risks.

subsections.name: AI system operation and monitoring
subsections.description: The organization shall define and document the necessary elements for the ongoing operation of the AI system. At the minimum, this should include system and performance monitoring, repairs, updates and support.

programControlMapping.name: Measuring AI system performance
programControlMapping.description: AI system performance and reliability criteria are measured qualitatively or quantitatively as part of the ongoing system usage in production, and performance improvements are identified and implemented according to the company's product development lifecycle.

subsections.name: AI system technical documentation
subsections.description: The organization shall determine what AI system technical documentation is needed for each relevant category of interested parties, such as users, partners, supervisory authorities, and provide the technical documentation to them in the appropriate form.

programControlMapping.name: AI system lifecycle
programControlMapping.description: The company has integrated its AI system lifecycle into its standard Agile, Quality, and CICD processes, with special consideration for the unique properties of AI systems balanced against organizational risks.

subsections.name: AI system recording of event logs
subsections.description: The organization shall determine at which phases of the AI system life cycle, record keeping of event logs should be enabled, but at the minimum when the AI system is in use.

programControlMapping.name: AI systems logging and monitoring
programControlMapping.description: The company uses logging and monitoring tools to track the usage of AI systems and identify potential issues.

programPolicyMapping.title: AI Governance Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the objectives, practices, and governance around the use of Artificial Intelligence.

subsections.name: Data for development and enhancement of AI system
subsections.description: The organization shall define, document and implement data management processes related to the development of AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI system disclosure and consent
programControlMapping.description: Information is provided to users of the AI system on the scope, capabilities, and usage of data within its AI systems, and user consent is obtained before using the user actions or data within AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: Handling of customer data in AI
programControlMapping.description: The proper handling of customer data in the use and training of AI is documented in the company's AI Responsible Use Policy.

programControlMapping.name: AI test sets
programControlMapping.description: Test sets are defined for each AI system, which can be made up of both automated and manual tests, and the tests are regularly conducted throughout the AI system development life cycle.

subsections.name: Acquisition of data
subsections.description: The organization shall determine and document details about the acquisition and selection of the data used in AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI data acquisition and selection
programControlMapping.description: The company has defined procedures for the acquisition and selection of data used in AI systems.

programControlMapping.name: AI system disclosure and consent
programControlMapping.description: Information is provided to users of the AI system on the scope, capabilities, and usage of data within its AI systems, and user consent is obtained before using the user actions or data within AI systems.

subsections.name: Quality of data for AI systems
subsections.description: The organization shall define and document requirements for data quality and ensure that data used to develop and operate the AI system meet those requirements.

programControlMapping.name: AI data quality
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains standards for data quality in AI systems, and has defined procedures for assessing that the data used in AI systems meet those standards.

subsections.name: Data provenance
subsections.description: The organization shall define and document a process for recording the provenance of data used in its AI systems over the life cycles of the data and the AI system.

programControlMapping.name: AI data chain of custody
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a history of data chain of custody used for training and as a source for its data models.

subsections.name: Data preparation
subsections.description: The organization shall define and document its criteria for selecting data preparations and the data preparation methods to be used.

programControlMapping.name: AI data preparation
programControlMapping.description: The company has implemented criteria for selecting and implementing data preparation methods.
